author: Patricia Hurtado
description: A federal judge said the US can’t immediately deport Mahmoud Khalil, blocking the Trump administration’s attempts to get another court to give it permission to ship the former Columbia University graduate student out of the country.
title: Ex-Columbia Student Wins Ruling Blocking Deportation, for Now

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Donald Trump delivered another warning to Brazil to drop charges against former leader Jair Bolsonaro over an alleged coup attempt, saying he would be “watching closely” for a response a week after the US president threatened punishing tariffs on the country.
title: Trump Writes to Bolsonaro, Says He’s Watching Brazil ‘Closely’

author: Aya Wagatsuma, Alice French
description: Investors are bracing for a potential triple dip in Japanese bonds, stocks and the yen after Sunday’s upper house election, as polls point to a defeat for Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s Liberal Democratic Party.
title: Traders’ Guide to Navigating Japan’s Upper House Election

author: Kelcee Griffis
description: A cost-cutting package fast-tracked through Congress is poised to decimate a system that has supported public TV and radio stations for nearly six decades.
title: How Congress’ Cuts Will Squeeze Public Broadcasting

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan told the Group of 20 countries that tariffs are not an appropriate measure to fix imbalances, and that countries facing such situations need to address them through domestic efforts, said Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato.
title: Japan’s Kato Says Domestic Reform the Best Way to Fix Imbalances

author: Alastair Gale, Sakura Murakami, Yoshiaki Nohara
description: The outlook for Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba looks bleak should his ruling coalition fail to hold on to a majority in Sunday’s upper house election.
title: Japan’s Ishiba Faces Tough Choices If LDP Suffers Election Blow

author: Sri Taylor, Brett Pulley
description: The head of the largest transit system in Atlanta is stepping down as a result of problems with his immigration status.
title: CEO of Atlanta Transit System Steps Down After Delay in Getting Green Card

author: Daniel Hornak
description: Slovakia accepted guarantees from the European Union’s executive arm to limit the fallout from a planned cutoff of Russian gas supplies and, in exchange, will lift its veto on the bloc’s 18th sanctions package against Moscow.
title: Slovakia Lifts Block on Russia Sanctions, Accepts EU Guarantees

author: Olivia Fishlow, Bella Farr
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren asked US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and various ratings agencies for more information on risks posed by the $1.7 trillion private-credit industry.
title: Senator Warren Asks Ratings Firms How They Assess Private Credit Risk

author: Gregory Korte
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Gregory Korte looks at the Trump administration’s latest budget maneuvers. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: White House Says ‘More Partisan’ Spending Bills Are Better

author: Josh Sisco
description: A judge delayed an Aug. 11 trial against Alphabet Inc.’s Google over claims by a Texas-led group of states that the company illegally monopolized the market for tools to publish online display advertisements.
title: Texas Google Antitrust Trial Delayed Pending Related DOJ Case

author: Yash Roy, Olga Kharif, Emily Mason
description: Congress delivered a watershed victory for the crypto industry on Thursday, passing the first federal legislation to regulate stablecoins and clearing the way for broader use of the technology in everyday finance.
title: Crypto Market Gets Major Win as Congress Passes Stablecoin Bill

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: The supply of Canada’s government debt is set to hit a record this fiscal year as Prime Minister Mark Carney pledges to use the federal balance sheet to make investments in the economy.
title: Debt Demands Rise in Canada as Carney Prepares More Spending

author: Sri Taylor
description: President Donald Trump’s budget bill that could deeply cut the nation’s largest public health-insurance program stands to hurt some states more than others, according to Barclays Plc.
title: Barclays Sees Medicaid Reductions Hurting 15 States the Most

author: Greg Stohr
description: President Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to turn away a challenge to his sweeping tariffs, telling the justices they should let the legal fight develop before getting involved.
title: Trump Urges Supreme Court to Reject Challenge to His Tariffs

author: Akayla Gardner
description: White House doctors diagnosed Donald Trump with chronic venous insufficiency, though the physicians said the US president remained in “excellent health,” Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said.
title: Trump Diagnosed With Vein Disease Tied to Swollen Ankles

author: Alex Wickham
description: Keir Starmer’s Labour Party has suspended a veteran left-wing Member of Parliament and launched an investigation into comments she made about anti-Jewish racism, the latest in a spate of ill-discipline dogging the British prime minister.
title: UK Labour Suspends Veteran Left-Wing MP Over Anti-Semitism Row

author: Ott Ummelas, Jorge Valero
description: Iceland will start talks with the European Union on a defense partnership as part of its tightening relationship with the trade bloc.
title: Iceland, EU to Start Talks on Security and Defense Partnership

author: Tope Alake, Gabrielle Coppola, Annie Lee
description: The US Commerce Department imposed preliminary anti-dumping duties of 93.5% on Chinese imports of graphite, a key battery component, after concluding the materials had been unfairly subsidized.
title: US Set to Impose 93.5% Tariff on Battery Material From China

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Jair Bolsonaro’s return to the spotlight thanks to US President Donald Trump’s recent public defense has revived debate over who’ll represent the right in Brazil’s next presidential election, given that the former president is ineligible and could even face prison time.
title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro Touts Wife’s Senate Bid Amid Presidential Speculation

author: Antony Sguazzin, Matthew Hill, Erica Yokoyama
description: As some of the world’s most powerful finance ministers meet at a beach-side resort in South Africa, this year’s Group of 20 host is trying to keep its agenda on course.
title: G-20 Tries to Keep Agenda On Course in Face of Trump’s Trade War

author: Kelcee Griffis
description: The US should pull back on sharing intelligence with Spain, given that the country allegedly relies on Chinese network vendor Huawei Technologies Co. to support its wiretap system, according to the head of the Senate Intelligence Committee.
title: US Must Limit Intel-Sharing With Spain Over Huawei Concern, Cotton Says

author: Joe Lovinger
description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton threatened to arrest state Democrats who obstruct plans to draw new congressional maps, raising the stakes for a controversial effort backed by President Donald Trump as a way of protecting the slim Republican majority in the US House of Representatives.
title: Texas' Paxton Threatens to Arrest Democratic Lawmakers If They Flee to Block Redistricting

author: Ellen Milligan
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer hinted the UK may join Germany in purchasing weapons from the US to give to Ukraine, as western allies seek to shore up the conflict-torn nation’s defenses in its war against Russian invaders.
title: Starmer Hints at UK-US Talks to Purchase Missiles for Ukraine

author: Amanda Albright, Elizabeth Rembert
description: Harvard University’s ongoing clash with the Trump administration has sparked a flurry of trading activity in the municipal bond market for its tax-exempt debt.
title: Harvard Bonds Draw Buyers as Clash With Trump Fuels Selloff

author: Arne Delfs
description: Friedrich Merz has repeatedly said that his goal as chancellor is to position Germany as a leader in Europe. But less than three months after assuming power, it is becoming clear that one of his main strategies for doing so is through opposing the EU – and in particular, the ambitions of Commission President Ursula von der Leyen.
title: Merz Balks at EU Plan to Splurge Half a Trillion of German Money

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israel will boost defense expenditure by 42 billion shekels ($12.5 billion) over the next two years to meet the costs of last month’s war with Iran and the ongoing conflict in Gaza.
title: Israel to Boost Budget by $12.5 Billion for Iran and Gaza Wars

author: Arne Delfs
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz rebuffed the European Commission’s new €2 trillion ($2.3 trillion) budget plan, dismissing any attempt to tax his country’s companies.
title: EU Has to Make Do With the Money It Has, Germany’s Merz Says

author: Michael Sasso, Augusta Saraiva
description: Expectations for widespread price hikes following a wave of new tariffs this year have largely fallen short, surprising economists and fueling claims from tariff defenders that the levies are having no impact on inflation.
title: US Consumers Get Early Taste of Tariff Price Hikes as Inflation Set to Rise

author: Sofia Sorochinskaia
description: Russia’s State Duma approved new fines for searching for content considered “extremist” and virtual private network providers that enable access to that material as authorities deepen a long-running crackdown on the internet.
title: Russia Approves Fines for ‘Extremist’ Searches and VPN Promotion

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Former Thai Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra suggested the country create a golden visa scheme for wealthy foreigners to become long-term residents and called on Airports of Thailand Pcl to hike passenger service fees to boost the sluggish economy.
title: Thaksin Touts Golden Visa, Higher Travel Fees to Boost Thailand

author: Gregory Korte
description: President Donald Trump’s budget director said he’s not the heir to Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency — but that he is still focused on looking for ways to cut waste and deregulate the economy.
title: Trump’s Budget Director Says He’s Not Running DOGE — But He Is Cutting Waste

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Jim Walden, a long-shot independent candidate in New York City’s mayoral race, said he’s the best hope to defeat democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani because he’s untainted by scandal.
title: Meet the NYC Mayoral Hopeful Who Says He’s Scandal-Free

author: Charlie Duxbury, Oliver Crook
description: Sweden’s finance chief said the European Union needs to work quickly and stand firm in its tariff negotiations with the US as the bloc seeks to end the costly uncertainty triggered by the protracted trade talks.
title: EU Must Be ‘Frank, Quick’ in Trade Talks With US, Sweden Says

author: Antony Sguazzin, Ntando Thukwana
description: UK Chancellor Rachel Reeves announced an infrastructure partnership with the South African government to boost investment in Africa’s biggest economy.
title: UK’s Reeves Announces South Africa Infrastructure Partnership to Boost Investment

author: David Voreacos
description: Migrants at a new detention facility in the Florida Everglades filed a lawsuit claiming they have been denied access to lawyers and the courts in violation of their constitutional rights.
title: ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ Migrants Sue to Gain Access to Attorneys

author: Ethan Bronner
description: The departure of two ultra-Orthodox parties from Israel’s government leaves Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu politically weakened just as he seeks a ceasefire in Gaza, military dominance in southern Syria and influence over US policy toward Iran.
title: Netanyahu Weaker But Still in Control After Government Walkouts

author: Jennifer Zabasajja, Ntando Thukwana
description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana said the Group of 20 advanced economies are nearing a deal on a communiqué.
title: G-20 Nearing Deal on Communique, South Africa Finance Chief Says

author: Ellen Milligan, Arne Delfs
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer and German Chancellor Friedrich Merz signed a new treaty that includes a commitment for the two nations to assist each other in case of armed attack, part of a wider reset of post-Brexit ties.
title: Starmer and Merz Ink Treaty Locking in Cooperation on Defense

author: Michael Msika
description: The idea that the Federal Reserve operates free from political pressures is a “myth” and US stocks are likely to keep soaring on bets that interest rate cuts are coming, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s Ilan Benhamou.
title: Fed Independence Is a ‘Myth,’ JPMorgan’s Benhamou Says

author: John Ainger, Jorge Valero
description: The €400 billion ($463 billion) crisis tool proposed by the European Commission on Wednesday would be financed using joint borrowing, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Proposes Joint Borrowing to Finance €400 Billion Crisis Tool

author: William Horobin
description: The French government’s contested plan to rein in the budget deficit goes in the right direction to tackle deep problems in public finances, the chief of the central bank said.
title: French Central Bank Chief Praises Plan to Fix ‘Very Excessive Deficit’

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK plans to lower the voting age to allow 16- and 17-year-olds to participate in the next general election, as part of a package of electoral reforms that also include clamping down on political donations from foreign donors.
title: UK Plans to Lower Voting Age to 16 Before Next General Election

author: Kateryna Kadabashy
description: Deadly sectarian clashes in Syria seemingly eased on Thursday, after a ceasefire was announced between groups fighting in Suwayda and government forces started to withdraw from the Druze-majority southern province.
title: Syrian Clashes Ease After Israeli Air Strikes in Damascus

author: Colum Murphy
description: Only a few years ago, the Biden administration declared export controls a “new strategic asset” to help the US maintain “as large a lead as possible” over China in advanced technology. President Donald Trump is now upending that approach.
title: Trump’s U-Turn on Nvidia Spurs Talk of Grand Bargain With China

author: Jenni Marsh, Yujing Liu
description: President Xi Jinping questioned the need for local governments across China to crowd into the same emerging industries, a rare bit of public blunt-speaking from Xi that flicks at a problem exacerbating deflation at home and driving trade tensions abroad.
title: Xi Wonders If All Chinese Provinces Need to Flood Into AI, EVs

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: Top executives at some of Russia’s biggest banks have privately discussed seeking a state-funded bailout if the level of bad loans on their books continues to worsen over the next year.
title: Russian Banks Have Discussed Seeking Bailouts Within Next Year

author: Nancy Cook
description: Passage of Donald Trump’s sweeping tax, health and spending bill was no small feat for Republicans, but selling it to the American people may prove to be tougher, even for a president who built a career on savvy branding.
title: Trump Struggles to Market His Tax Law That 61% of Voters Oppose

author: Alan Crawford
description: The growing controversy around the disgraced financier threatens to become the most serious challenge yet to the president’s grip on the Republican Party.
title: Trump Threatened by Epstein-Fueled MAGA Rage

author: Tom Rees
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ first budget appears to have cost fewer jobs than previously estimated, casting fresh doubt over the state of the British labor market after a string of data issues in recent years.
title: UK Jobs Hit from Reeves’ Budget Tax Hike Less Severe Than Feared

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand is set to offer scrapping tariffs on 90% of US goods, up from a previous plan for over 60%, in a bid to avert a punishing levy threatened by President Donald Trump, according to a business group advising Thai negotiators.
title: Thailand to Offer Trump No Duties on 90% of Goods, Adviser Says

author: Daniel Basteiro, Rodrigo Orihuela
description: As Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez faces the toughest political crisis of his tenure, rocked by corruption probes into two top aides, one of his most trusted allies is stepping up with a message of support: look ahead and march on.
title: Catalan Ally Becomes Stability Force in Spain as Sánchez Falters

author: Norman Harsono, Ben Otto
description: Indonesia will keep talking with the US on sectoral tariffs, jet purchases and critical minerals after securing a 19% baseline tariff rate on exports to the world’s largest economy, a government adviser said Thursday.
title: Indonesia to Continue Talks on Jets, Minerals After Tariffs Deal

author: Ken Tran, Erik Wasson, Jack Fitzpatrick
description: Republicans are set to succeed in their decades-long quest to end federal funding for public broadcasting after the Senate passed a $9 billion package of cuts derived from Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency effort.
title: PBS, NPR Set to Lose Federal Funding as Senate Passes DOGE Cuts

author: Arun Devnath
description: Bangladesh’s interim government has imposed a curfew and deployed the army to contain violence in the political stronghold of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina’s party after attacks on a student-led rally.
title: Bangladesh Imposes Curfew After Violence in Hasina’s Stronghold

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Swiss exports to the US rebounded in June, evidence that trade between the two countries remains robust despite the pressure of ongoing tariff negotiations.
title: Swiss Exports to US Rebound With Trump Trade Deal in Limbo

author: Michael Nienaber, Jorge Valero, Lyubov Pronina
description: Germany has rejected the European Commission’s €2 trillion ($2.3 trillion) budget proposal, hours after it was announced by European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in Brussels.
title: Germany Rejects EU’s €2 Trillion Budget Plan as Maneuvers Begin

author: Akemi Terukina, Takashi Umekawa
description: Japan’s opposition parties played down concerns over plans to cut taxes that have contributed to recent rises in bond yields ahead of Sunday’s upper house election.
title: Japan’s Opposition Parties Play Down Concerns Over Tax-Cut Plans

author: Priscila Azevedo Rocha
description: Jon Cunliffe says there will be no quick fix ahead of his root and branch review of the water sector stretching from shareholders to sewage.
title: Can the Man Who Cleaned up UK Banks Fix the Water Industry?

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: The European Union’s defense industry chief, Andrius Kubilius, will visit Washington this week in a bid to ensure that the US pivot to the Indo-Pacific region doesn’t create gaps in Europe’s security.
title: EU Defense Chief Will Seek Clarity on Military Gaps in US Trip

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Olesia Safronova
description: Ukraine is set for the biggest government shake-up since Russia’s full-scale invasion as the country faces a pressing need to find more money for its defense following failed diplomatic efforts to end the war.
title: Ukraine to Approve Biggest Wartime Reshuffle to Boost Economy

author: Yash Roy
description: Republican conservatives dropped a two-day blockade of industry-backed crypto bills, opening the way for House votes on a series of measures backed by President Donald Trump.
title: Trump ‘Crypto Week’ Advances as House Conservatives End Blockade

author: Lucille Liu
description: A record share of American firms froze investments in China as trade ties worsened earlier this year, a recent survey suggests.
title: Record US Firms Cut China Investment Plans as Tariffs Spiraled

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he’s not planning to fire Jerome Powell, and still managed to make it sound like a threat.
title: Trump Escalates Campaign Against Fed Chair Powell

author: Leen Al-Rashdan
description: Five months after a Boeing Co. 737 Max aircraft operated by Lion Air crashed into the Java Sea in 2018, Indonesian flag carrier PT Garuda Indonesia tried to cancel its remaining order for the same model. Now, the country is working to revive that deal as it seeks to forge favorable ties with US President Donald Trump’s administration.
title: Trump’s Trade Deal Pushes Garuda to Learn to Love 737 Max Again

author: Erik Larson, Greg Stohr, Catarina Saraiva
description: Donald Trump’s relentless pressure on Jerome Powell is once again roiling markets and raising questions about what would happen next if the president fired the embattled Federal Reserve chair.
title: What Happens If Trump Fires Fed Chair Jerome Powell?

author: Swati Pandey
description: Australia’s relationship with China is “complex” and “has challenges,” Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles acknowledged, arguing that trust with his country’s No.1 trading partner can only be built through continued engagement.
title: Australia’s Relationship With China Is ‘Complex,’ Deputy PM Says

author: Ava Benny-Morrison, Myles Miller
description: Former FBI director James Comey’s daughter has been ousted from her job as a federal prosecutor in New York, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Ex-FBI Chief James Comey’s Daughter Ousted as Federal Prosecutor
